author: Udhav Naig
text:
Despite the Madras High Court refusing to give an interim stay on Ram Gopal Varma’s Telugu-Kannada bilingual film, ‘Killing Veerappan’, starring Shivaraj Kumar as a police officer, the movie has not released in Chennai and other parts of the State.

A petitioner from Salem had sought a ban the film, which is based on the life of the infamous smuggler Veerappan, who operated in Sathyamangalam forests and was killed allegedly in an encounter by the Special Task Force in 2004, on the grounds that it portrays the Tamil Nadu police and the Tamil people in bad light.

The narrative around Veerappan has been a point of contention for Tamil groups, who have sought to challenge the idea that he is merely a criminal and a smuggler.

Previously, a film titled ‘Vana Yudhdham’ featuring actor Arjun, ran into trouble after Veerappan’s wife filed a case saying that the content in the film was objectionable and it would hurt the reputation of her husband.

With the producers paying a compensation of Rs. 25 lakhs, the film was later released.

Ram Gopal Verma’s film too had got into several legal and financial issues.
title: ‘Killing Veerappan’ fails to release in Chennai
